question.q: What's the difference between a cyborg and an android?
question.a: Cyborgs are biological being with electromechanical enhancements. Androids are human-shaped robots.

question.q: Do you know any cyborg?
question.a: Professor Kevin Warwick. He implanted a chip in in his left arm to remotely operate doors an artificial hand and an electronic wheelchair.

Name the main rivers surrounding Leipzig
question.a: The Parthe Pleisse and the White Elster.

question.q: What is the Cospudener See?
question.a: The Cospudener See is a lake situated south of Leipzig on the site of a former open cast mine.

question.q: Where started the peaceful revolution of 1989?
question.a: The peaceful revolution started in September 4 1989 in Leipzig at the St. Nicholas Church.

question.q: Where is the world's oldest trade fair hosted?
question.a: The world's oldest trade fair is in Leipzig.

question.q: Where is one of the world's largest dark music festivals hosted?
question.a: Leipzig hosts one of the world's largest dark music festivals.

question.q: Where is Europe's oldest continuous coffee shop hosted?
question.a: Europe's oldest continuous coffee shop is in Leipzig.

question.q: Name one of the greatest German composers
Where is Johann Sebastian Bach buried?
question.a: Johann Sebastian Bach is buried in St. Thomas' Church here in Leipzig.

question.q: There are seven days in a week. True or false?
question.a: True there are seven days in a week.

question.q: There are eleven days in a week. True or false?
question.a: False there are seven days in a week not eleven.

question.q: January has 31 days. True or false?

question.a: False February has either 28 or 29 days. Depend on the year.

question.a: The word robot was first used by Czech writer Karel Capek.

question.q: What origin has the word Robot?
question.a: The Czech word robota that means forced work or labour
